turns.content:
Considering the ages of your children, I've adjusted the 4-day itinerary to include more family-friendly activities:

| Day | Morning | Afternoon | Evening | Travel Time |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| 1 | Depart from Milton Keynes | Arrive at Sandy Lane, 2 Oceanpoint | Rest and explore Ilfracombe town | 3 hours 45 minutes (217 miles) |
| 2 | Drive to Exeter | Visit Exeter Cathedral and Royal Albert Memorial Museum | Explore Exeter Quayside, rent bikes, or take a boat ride | 1 hour 30 minutes total |
| 3 | Drive to Torquay | Visit Babbacombe Model Village | Torre Abbey Gardens, followed by a visit to the beach or a walk along the seafront | 1 hour 45 minutes total |
| 4 | Visit Combe Martin Wildlife and Dinosaur Park (near Ilfracombe) | Drive to The Milky Way Adventure Park (near Clovelly) | Return to your accommodation in Ilfracombe | 1 hour 20 minutes total |
|  | Depart for Milton Keynes in the evening |  |  | 3 hours 45 minutes (217 miles) |

Day 2:

* Exeter Quayside is a great place for families to explore, with shops, cafes, and outdoor activities like boat trips or bike rentals.

Day 3:

* Torre Abbey Gardens in Torquay is a beautiful historic garden with interactive features for kids, including a medieval-inspired playground and a palm house.

Day 4:

* Combe Martin Wildlife and Dinosaur Park offers animal encounters, a dinosaur-themed trail, and play areas suitable for children of all ages.
* The Milky Way Adventure Park is an all-weather amusement park with indoor and outdoor attractions, including rides, soft play areas, and shows.

As always, this itinerary is just a suggestion and can be customized based on your family's interests and preferences. Be sure to check the opening hours and admission fees for each attraction before your visit and consider possible traffic or weather conditions that might affect your plans.
Add places to charge my Tesla in the route

Here's the revised 4-day itinerary with Tesla charging locations included:

| Day | Morning | Afternoon | Evening | Travel Time | Tesla Charging Stations |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| 1 | Depart from Milton Keynes | Arrive at Sandy Lane, 2 Oceanpoint | Rest and explore Ilfracombe town | 3 hours 45 minutes (217 miles) | Supercharger: M5 Junction 27, Tiverton |
| 2 | Drive to Exeter | Visit Exeter Cathedral and Royal Albert Memorial Museum | Explore Exeter Quayside, rent bikes, or take a boat ride | 1 hour 30 minutes total | Destination Charger: Exeter, Magdalen Road |
| 3 | Drive to Torquay | Visit Babbacombe Model Village | Torre Abbey Gardens, followed by a visit to the beach or a walk along the seafront | 1 hour 45 minutes total | Destination Charger: Torquay, Corbyn Head Hotel |
| 4 | Visit Combe Martin Wildlife and Dinosaur Park (near Ilfracombe) | Drive to The Milky Way Adventure Park (near Clovelly) | Return to your accommodation in Ilfracombe | 1 hour 20 minutes total | Supercharger: M5 Junction 27, Tiverton |
|  | Depart for Milton Keynes in the evening |  |  | 3 hours 45 minutes (217 miles) | Supercharger: M5 Junction 27, Tiverton |

Tesla Charging Stations:

1. Supercharger: M5 Junction 27, Tiverton – Located at the Tiverton Services, this station is on your way to Ilfracombe from Milton Keynes and on your return trip. It has 8 charging stalls.
2. Destination Charger: Exeter, Magdalen Road – Located at The Magdalen Chapter Hotel, this charging station has 2 Tesla chargers and is close to the city center.
3. Destination Charger: Torquay, Corbyn Head Hotel – Located at Corbyn Head Hotel, this station has 2 Tesla chargers and is near the seafront.

Please note that the availability of charging stations can change, so it's a good idea to use the Tesla navigation system or the Tesla app to find up-to-date information on charging locations and the number of available chargers. Additionally, always check the opening hours and admission fees for each attraction before your visit, and consider possible traffic or weather conditions that might affect your plans.

Here are some Tesla and other EV charging stations near EX34 7AY, which is in Ilfracombe, Devon:

1. Tesla Destination Charger:
	* The Carlton Hotel
	Address: Runnacleave Road, Ilfracombe, Devon, EX34 8AR
	Number of Chargers: 1 Tesla charger
2. Other EV Charging Stations:
	* Ilfracombe Town Council Car Park (GeniePoint)
	Address: Wilder Road, Ilfracombe, Devon, EX34 8AF
	Number of Chargers: 1 Rapid charger (Type 2, CCS, and CHAdeMO)
	* Lidl Ilfracombe (Pod Point)
	Address: Kiln Car Park, Ilfracombe, Devon, EX34 9LA
	Number of Chargers: 2 Fast chargers (Type 2)

Please note that the availability of charging stations can change, and it's a good idea to check an EV charging map or app, such as Zap-Map, for the most up-to-date information on charging locations and the number of available chargers. Additionally, always confirm the opening hours and admission fees for each attraction before your visit, and consider possible traffic or weather conditions that might affect your plans.

Torquay, known as the "Queen of the English Riviera," is a popular seaside resort town in Devon, England. It boasts picturesque beaches, beautiful gardens, and a variety of attractions. Here are some must-visit places in Torquay:

1. Babbacombe Model Village: This miniature village features thousands of tiny buildings, people, and vehicles set in beautifully landscaped gardens. It's a fun and fascinating attraction for visitors of all ages.
2. Kents Cavern: One of Europe's most important Stone Age sites, Kents Cavern offers guided tours through its extensive prehistoric cave system, providing insights into the lives of early humans.
3. Living Coasts: This coastal zoo and aquarium is home to a variety of marine life, including penguins, seals, and sea birds. Interactive exhibits and daily feeding displays make it an entertaining and educational experience for all ages.
4. Torre Abbey: A historic building and museum, Torre Abbey is set within beautiful gardens and features interactive exhibits, art collections, and even a medieval-inspired children's playground.
5. Torquay Harbour: Stroll along the picturesque waterfront and marina, where you can find shops, restaurants, and boat trips. Enjoy the vibrant atmosphere or relax by the sea.
6. Paignton Zoo: Just a short drive from Torquay, this well-known zoo houses more than 2,000 animals and has a strong focus on conservation. It's a great day out for the whole family.
7. Cockington Country Park: This historic park and village offer beautiful gardens, walking trails, and thatched-roof cottages. It's the perfect spot for a leisurely stroll or a picnic.
8. Bygones: Step back in time at this unique attraction, which features three floors of British history displays, including a Victorian street scene, a World War I trench, and a 1950s shopping arcade.
9. Princess Theatre: Catch a show or concert at this popular theatre, which hosts a variety of performances throughout the year, including musicals, plays, and comedy acts.
10. Oddicombe Beach: Accessed by the Babbacombe Cliff Railway, this lovely beach offers a relaxed atmosphere, beautiful views, and water sports opportunities.

These are just a few of the many attractions and activities Torquay has to offer. Whether you're interested in history, nature, or simply relaxing by the sea, there's something for everyone to enjoy.
